name: Crackle Thins
author: DIANA G
summary: These are very tasty little crackers that use cornmeal and resemble homemade tortilla chips. If desired, top them with coarse salt, chili powder, cumin or garlic powder before baking.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Lightly grease two 9x13 inch baking pans
In a small bowl, mix the milk, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce and hot pepper sauce
In a medium bowl, mix the cornmeal, flour, salt and baking soda
Stir in the milk mixture, and blend until a ball of dough has formed
On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough for approximately 5 minutes
Roll each half onto a baking sheet
Cut into small squares or triangles
Bake in the preheated oven 15 minutes, or until golden brown
Allow to cool slightly before removing from baking sheets
